Physical Exam: Vital signs assessment (blood pressure, heart rate, temperature)
Justification: To evaluate the patient's overall health status and identify any signs of systemic infection or other abnormalities.
To assess for any tenderness, masses, or organomegaly that may indicate underlying issues related to the urinary system or other abdominal organs.

Physical Exam: Genitourinary examination (external genitalia inspection, palpation of bladder)
Justification: To check for any abnormalities in the external genitalia and assess bladder distension or tenderness.
To evaluate for any kidney-related issues, such as pyelonephritis, which may present with CVA tenderness.
To assess for any gynecological issues that may contribute to urinary symptoms, particularly in female patients.
